item.title: Monster Help lol
item.dc:creator: @daone8 daone8
item.description:
@daone8 wrote:

[quote=“badger41, post:9, topic:354863”][quote author=WaleedScape link=topic=451432.msg3308892#msg3308892 date=1281839172]
ughh…

if (type == 1637) { if (playerLevel[18] >= 30) { sM("You must be level 30 slayer or higher to attack this monster.");

REEALLYY basic code, i know.
also, why did you do:

break;

you’re not using a case to break (end) it?
and two brackets? you’d give him 100 errors. your code is incorrect. so dont go saying it works. why am i telling u?

because:

  1. You added a break; to the end of the code, without declaring a case?
  2. You added TWO brackets, which would, cause either 100 errors, or a parsing error (inlcuded with 100 errors)

incorrect code
[/quote]

your signs are wrong it needs to be < 30, not >= 30[/quote]No its not. >= is less than or equal to 30. < 30 means equal to 30. so if he were to put < 30 he could attack at level 1…I think…

Read full topic

item.title: Monster Help lol
item.dc:creator: @WaleedScape WaleedScape
item.description:
@WaleedScape wrote:

ughh…

if (type == 1637) { if (playerLevel[18] >= 30) { sM("You must be level 30 slayer or higher to attack this monster.");

REEALLYY basic code, i know.
also, why did you do:

break;

you’re not using a case to break (end) it?
and two brackets? you’d give yourself 100 errors

because:

  1. You added a break; to the end of the code, without declaring a case?
  2. You added TWO brackets, which would, cause either 100 errors, or a parsing error (inlcuded with 100 errors)
  3. this if (playerLevel[21] < 20) { means you cant attack the monster unless you have a level LOWER than 20.
  4. it doesnt work

incorrect code

Read full topic
